title: Learn Python: From Novice to Practitioner
description: Embark on a guided journey to master Python programming, building a strong foundation and progressing to real-world application.

tasks.label: Setting Up Your Python Environment
tasks.description: Install Python, choose and set up an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) like VS Code, and run your very first 'Hello World!' script to confirm your setup.

tasks.label: Variables, Data Types & Operators
tasks.description: Understand how to declare variables, differentiate between fundamental data types (integers, floats, strings, booleans), and use arithmetic, comparison, and logical operators.

tasks.label: Controlling Program Flow: Conditionals
tasks.description: Learn to make decisions in your code using `if`, `elif`, and `else` statements based on conditions, including nested conditionals.

tasks.label: Controlling Program Flow: Loops
tasks.description: Master `for` loops for iterating over sequences and `while` loops for repeating actions based on a condition, including the use of `break` and `continue`.

tasks.label: Working with Sequences: Lists & Tuples
tasks.description: Create, manipulate, and iterate through ordered, indexed collections of items using lists (mutable) and tuples (immutable).

tasks.label: Working with Mappings & Sets: Dictionaries & Sets
tasks.description: Understand and apply dictionaries for key-value pair storage and sets for unique, unordered collections, performing common operations like adding, removing, and checking membership.

tasks.label: Organizing Code with Functions
tasks.description: Define and call reusable blocks of code, understand function parameters, arguments, return values, and variable scope (local vs. global).

tasks.label: Modules and Packages: Reusing Code
tasks.description: Learn to import and utilize Python's extensive standard library modules and external packages, as well as create your own simple modules to organize code.

tasks.label: File Input/Output (I/O): Interacting with Files
tasks.description: Perform basic file operations: open, read from, and write to text files, securely managing file resources using `with open()` context managers.

tasks.label: Error Handling: `try-except` Blocks
tasks.description: Implement `try`, `except`, `else`, and `finally` blocks to gracefully handle runtime errors, making your programs more robust.

tasks.label: Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
tasks.description: Grasp the core concepts of OOP: classes, objects, attributes, and methods, and understand basic principles like encapsulation.

tasks.label: Advanced Data Structures & Comprehensions
tasks.description: Explore efficient and Pythonic ways to create and manipulate sequences and mappings using list, dictionary, and set comprehensions.

tasks.label: Working with External Libraries: Practical Application
tasks.description: Learn to install and use a common third-party library (e.g., `requests` for web interactions or `csv` for data processing) to solve a practical problem.

tasks.label: Capstone Project: Building a Command-Line Utility
tasks.description: Design and implement a small, interactive command-line application (e.g., a simple task manager or file organizer) that integrates functions, data structures, file I/O, and error handling.
